intro: Cladocarpa niihauensis, commonly known as Niihau hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Niihau. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
